intro: Cacalia barbata, commonly known as the hairy beggar-tick, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features slender, hairy stems and narrow, alternate leaves that are often covered in fine pubescence. Its small, yellowish flowers are arranged in clusters and bloom in late summer to early fall. Cacalia barbata is often found in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and disturbed soils.
